items.text: **Vision Eternel** (formerly **Vision Éternel**) is a [[LINK|lang_en|Canadians|Canadian]]-[[LINK|lang_en|Americans|American]] [[LINK|lang_en|Dark_ambient|dark ambient]], [[LINK|lang_en|Shoegazing|shoegaze]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Space_rock|space-rock]] [[LINK|lang_en|Musical_ensemble|band]] based in [[LINK|lang_en|montreal|Montreal]], [[LINK|lang_en|quebec|Quebec]].[[CITE|1|https://web.archive.org/web/20170906054726/https://www.last.fm/music/Vision+%C3%89ternel/+wiki]] The band was formed in [[LINK|lang_en|Edison,_New_Jersey|Edison]], [[LINK|lang_en|New_Jersey|New Jersey]], [[LINK|lang_en|United_States|United States]] in January 2007 by [[LINK|lang_en|Guitarist|guitarist]] Alexandre Julien, while [[LINK|lang_en|Experimental_music|experimenting ]] with various [[LINK|lang_en|Audio_signal_processing|guitar effects]] during a [[LINK|lang_en|Studio_recording|studio recording]] session.[[CITE|2|https://web.archive.org/web/20170125080118/http://www.theinarguable.com/2010/10/new-vision-eternel-song-and-video-up.html]] In August 2007, after having recorded its firts two [[LINK|lang_en|Extended_play|extended plays]] in New Jersey, the band relocated to Montreal, Quebec, [[LINK|lang_en|canada|Canada]].[[CITE|3|https://web.archive.org/web/20190207190230/https://www.visioneternel.com/vision-eternel-relocates-to-canada/]] Over the course of its first year, the band had several other members before Julien ultimately decided to continue Vision Eternel alone. Some of the [[LINK|lang_en|artist|artists ]] and [[LINK|lang_en|musician|musicians]] who have participated in or [[LINK|lang_en|Collaboration|collaborated]] with Vision Eternel over the years include members of [[LINK|lang_en|Mutiny_Within|Mutiny Within]], [[LINK|lang_en|Priestess_(band)|Priestess]], [[LINK|lang_en|An_Albatross|An Albatross]], [[LINK|lang_en|Hacride|Hacride]], [[LINK|lang_en|Boize_(band)|Boize]], Eliminator, Mad Parish, Soufferance, Cara Neir, Beyond the Dune Sea, Citadel Swamp and sister-project Vision Lunar.[[CITE|1|https://web.archive.org/web/20170906054726/https://www.last.fm/music/Vision+%C3%89ternel/+wiki]][[CITE|4|https://web.archive.org/web/20170906050356/https://postrockcommunity.blogspot.ca/2010/08/vision-eternel-seul-dans-lobsession-ep.html]][[CITE|5|https://web.archive.org/web/20130603084957/https://visioneternel.bandcamp.com/album/the-last-great-torch-song]][[CITE|6|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9otdTpFiSl8]][[CITE|25|http://twitter.com/visioneternel]]

The band's name is [[LINK|lang_en|Pronunciation|pronounced]] as *Vision Eternal* is in [[LINK|lang_en|English_language|English]]; the purpose of the name's original [[LINK|lang_en|Spelling|spelling]] is purely for [[LINK|lang_en|aesthetics|aesthetics]].[[CITE|7|https://web.archive.org/web/20170909213102/https://www.discogs.com/artist/826752-Vision-Éternel]] From 2007 to 2018, the band spelled its name *Vision Éternel*, with an [[LINK|lang_en|Acute_accent|acute accent]] over the E; the accent has since been dropped with the band now performing as *Vision Eternel*.

The band is noted for its [[LINK|lang_en|Concept_album|concept albums]].[[CITE|8|https://web.archive.org/web/20150223180200/http://www.abridgedpause.com/abridged-pause-recordings-releases-vision-eternels-echoes-forgotten-hearts]][[LINK|lang_en|Recurring| Recurring]] [[LINK|lang_en|Theme_(arts)|themes]] center around [[LINK|lang_en|Infatuation|infatuation]], [[LINK|lang_en|Abandonment_(emotional)|abandonment]], [[LINK|lang_en|Emptiness|emptiness]], [[LINK|lang_en|Broken_Heart|heartbreak]], [[LINK|lang_en|Loneliness|loneliness]], [[LINK|lang_en|Social_isolation|isolation]], [[LINK|lang_en|Depression_(mood)|depression]], [[LINK|lang_en|Melancholia|melancholia]], [[LINK|lang_en|Nostalgia|nostalgia]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Nihilism|nihilism]].[[CITE|2|https://web.archive.org/web/20170125080118/http://www.theinarguable.com/2010/10/new-vision-eternel-song-and-video-up.html]][[CITE|9|https://web.archive.org/web/20170818041013/http://triskalyon.50webs.com/bands/visioneterneldiscography.html]][[CITE|10|https://web.archive.org/web/20100719224334/http://sadnessbyname.blogspot.com:80/2010/03/interview-with-virkelix-of-vision.html]] Because of his dissatisfaction being [[LINK|lang_en|Labelling|labelled]] and narrowed down to an [[LINK|lang_en|Ambient_music|ambient]], [[LINK|lang_en|Dark_ambient|dark ambient]] or [[LINK|lang_en|Post-rock|post-rock]] band, Julien ultimately [[LINK|lang_en|Protologism|coined]] the new term *melogaze*, which according to the band, bridged a connection between the [[LINK|lang_en|Music_genre|style of music]] played and the dramatic and emotional themes represented on their concept albums.[[CITE|11|https://web.archive.org/web/20170812065430/https://www.visioneternel.com/vision-eternel-officially-coins-the-term-melogaze/]] The band is also noted for portraying an old fashioned, bygone era of Montreal. Part of this image is recreated in [[LINK|lang_en|Music_video|music videos]] and promotional pictures in which the band wears [[LINK|lang_en|Fedora|fedora]] [[LINK|lang_en|Hat|hats]] and turned-up [[LINK|lang_en|Overcoat|overcoats]]; an appearance which Julien accredited to his obsession with [[LINK|lang_en|History_of_film|classic films]], especially [[LINK|lang_en|Film_noir|film noirs]] (and [[LINK|lang_en|Neo-noir|neo-noirs]]), [[LINK|lang_en|German_Expressionism|expressionism]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Drama_(film_and_television)|melodramas]]. Directors such as [[LINK|lang_en|Alfred_Hitchcock|Alfred Hitchcock]], [[LINK|lang_en|Douglas_Sirk|Douglas Sirk]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Jean-Pierre_Melville|Jean-Pierre Melville]] have been cited as major influences for Vision Eternel.[[CITE|12|https://web.archive.org/web/20170817082643/https://www.visioneternel.com/vision-eternel-photo-shoot-at-dalhousie-station/]][[CITE|13|https://web.archive.org/web/20170812064446/https://www.visioneternel.com/vision-eternel-photo-shoot-on-ile-sainte-helene/]][[CITE|14|https://web.archive.org/web/20170829040416/https://www.visioneternel.com/piece-no-trois-video-premieres-on-the-obelisk/]]

Vision Eternel has released five [[LINK|lang_en|Extended_play|extended plays]]: *Seul Dans L'obsession* in [[LINK|lang_en|2007_in_music|2007]], *Un Automne En Solitude* in [[LINK|lang_en|2008_in_music|2008]], *Abondance De Périls* in [[LINK|lang_en|2010_in_music|2010]], *The Last Great Torch Song* in [[LINK|lang_en|2012_in_music|2012]] and *Echoes From Forgotten Hearts* in [[LINK|lang_en|2015_in_music|2015]].[[CITE|15|https://web.archive.org/web/20170909214629/https://musicbrainz.org/artist/b7cf43cb-a740-4bbc-a2e1-0f8b4473157b/releases]][[CITE|16|https://web.archive.org/web/20170909214504/http://www.allmusic.com/artist/vision-%C3%89ternel-mn0003618779/discography/singles]] The first two EPs were released through Mortification Records, while Abridged Pause Recordings has released the three most recent.[[CITE|7|https://web.archive.org/web/20170909213102/https://www.discogs.com/artist/826752-Vision-Éternel]] In [[LINK|lang_en|2009_in_music|2009]], a [[LINK|lang_en|Japanese|Japanese]]-exclusive [[LINK|lang_en|Compilation_album|compilation album]] entitled *An Anthology Of Past Misfortunes* was released by Frozen Veins Records, which compiled all of the material originally released by Mortification Records with unreleased [[LINK|lang_en|A-side_and_B-side|b-sides]] and a [[LINK|lang_en|Poster|poster]].[[CITE|17|https://web.archive.org/web/20090218204351/http://www.frozenveinsrecords.com:80/?c=news#content]][[CITE|18|https://web.archive.org/web/20170909214929/https://visioneternel.bandcamp.com/album/an-anthology-of-past-misfortunes]] A [[LINK|lang_en|Special_edition|limited edition]] [[LINK|lang_en|Retrospective|retrospective]] [[LINK|lang_en|Box_set|boxed set]] entitled *An Anthology Of Past Misfortunes* (of no relation to the identically-titled 2009 Japanese compilation) was released by Abridged Pause Recordings in [[LINK|lang_en|2018_in_music|2018]]. The boxed set contains all of the material released by the band up to that point along with previously unreleased material and [[LINK|lang_en|Souvenir|memorabilia]].[[CITE|19|https://web.archive.org/web/20160106073022/http://www.abridgedpause.com/abridged-pause-recordings-2016-news-update]][[CITE|20|https://web.archive.org/web/20170812063633/https://www.visioneternel.com/abridged-pause-recordings-announces-vision-eternel-boxed-set-plans/]][[CITE|21|https://web.archive.org/web/20180411175317/http://theobelisk.net/obelisk/2018/04/11/vision-eternel-an-anthology-of-past-misfortunes-box-giveaway/]] Vision Eternel has been working on its sixth extended play, expected for release in early 2020.[[CITE|22|https://web.archive.org/web/20181119202319/https://web.archive.org/web/20180821204743/http://theobelisk.net/obelisk/2018/08/21/vision-eternel-ep-preview/]][[CITE|23|https://web.archive.org/web/20181119202319/https://web.archive.org/web/20181119201629/https://www.visioneternel.com/a-preview-of-for-farewell-of-nostalgia/]]

caption.text: Vision Eternel in the Laurentian Mountains, Quebec, Canada, April 2017.
